trans-unit.source: Provides information for a manifest signature.

Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformation.VerifySignature%2A> method to obtain a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformationCollection> object that can be use to examine the signature information.
Gets the Authenticode signature information for a manifest.

An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.AuthenticodeSignatureInformation"></xref> object that contains Authenticode signature information for the manifest, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there is no signature.
Gets the type of a manifest.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.ManifestKinds"></xref> values.
Gets the details of the strong name signature of a manifest.
A StrongNameSignature object that contains the signature, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there is no strong name signature.
Gathers and verifies information about the signatures of manifests that belong to a specified activation context.
The activation context of the manifest.
Activation contexts belong to an application and contain multiple manifests.
A collection that contains a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformation"></xref> object for each manifest that is verified.
The application parameter is .
Gathers and verifies information about the signatures of manifests that belong to a specified activation context and manifest type.
The activation context of the manifest.
Activation contexts belong to an application and contain multiple manifests.
The type of manifest.
This parameter specifies which manifests in the activation context you want to verify.
A collection that contains a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformation"></xref> object for each manifest that is verified.
The application parameter is .
Gathers and verifies information about the signatures of manifests that belong to a specified activation context and manifest type, and allows certificates to be selected for revocation.
The application context of the manifests.
Activation contexts belong to an application and contain multiple manifests.
The type of manifest.
This parameter specifies which manifests in the activation context you want to verify.
One of the enumeration values that specifies which certificates in the chain are checked for revocation.
The default is <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationFlag"></xref>.
Determines whether the X.509 verification should look online for revocation lists.
A collection that contains a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformation"></xref> object for each manifest that is verified.
The application parameter is .
A value specified for the revocationFlag or revocationMode parameter is invalid.
